conclusion: To analyze changes in shadows when light source moves, consider position and size.
Initial light source position is to the left of objects, casting shadows to the right.
Light source moves to the front right, away from objects, changing light ray direction.
Shadow A will move to the left and slightly backward.
Shadow B will shift to the left and slightly backward.
Shadow C will move to the left and slightly backward.
Shadow D will shift to the left and slightly backward.
Shadows will become larger as light source moves away due to increased angle.
Shadow A moves left and slightly backward, gets larger.
Shadow B moves left and slightly backward, gets larger.
Shadow C moves left and slightly backward, gets larger.
Shadow D moves left and slightly backward, gets larger.
Final answer: Shadows move left and slightly backward, become larger.
